div.p: This page provides a list of the FHIR artifacts defined as part of this implementation guide.
Constraints on FHIR resources to be adhered to as part of the CA-Core implementation guide

tr.td: Proposed constraints and extensions on the AllergyIntolerance Resource. Generated as a first step toward creating a set of Canadian Core FHIR profiles.
Proposed constraints and extensions on the Condition Resource. Generated as a first step toward creating a set of Canadian Core FHIR profiles.
Proposed constraints and extensions on the Device Resource. Generated as a first step toward creating a set of Canadian Core FHIR profiles.
Proposed constraints and extensions on the DiagnosticReport Resource. Generated as a first step toward creating a set of Canadian Core FHIR profiles.

td.a: • DiagnosticReport for Report and Note Profile

tr.td: Proposed constraints and extensions on the DiagnosticReport Resource to support collection of diagnostic report information for reports and notes. Generated as a first step toward creating a set of Canadian Core FHIR profiles.

div.p: Extensions defined as part of the CA-Core implementation guide

tr.td: A code classifying the person's sex assigned at birth. Replicates the birthsex extension in US-Core-R4 for interoperability.
Provides a reason why the expected value or elements in the element that is extended are missing.

A code classifying the person's ethnic group or ethnicity as the category of people who identify with each other, usually on the basis of a presumed common genealogy or ancestry or on other similarities.
If true, indicates that information entered is an estimate and may not be precise.
A version string indicating the currency/validity of an identifier.
This extension applies to the Address datatype and indicates that there is an assertion that there is no fixed address.
Indentifies languages that that services are provided in.

div.p: ValueSets (and Code Systems) defined for use within the CA-Core implementation guide

tr.td: Codes for documenting sex at birth. (Replicates the birthsex ValueSet in US-Core-R4 for interoperability.)
Codes representing a self-reported ethnic group. This should not be confused with citizenship or nationality.
Clinical problems, conditions, diagnoses, symptoms, findings and complaints, as interpreted by the provider.
The list of forms in which compounded drugs or active ingredients can be dispensed to the patient.
The list of commonly used Medicinal products used for prescribing and dispensing in Canada.
**Placeholder**\nCurrent and historical vaccines are published as separate lists by Canada Health Infoway.
